TURKIC 101A.description: Lecture, five hours. Course 101A is requisite to 101B, which is requisite to 101C. Grammar, reading, conversation, and elementary composition drills. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 101A.title: Elementary Turkish

TURKIC 101B.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisite: course 101A. Grammar, reading, conversation, and elementary composition drills. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 101B.title: Elementary Turkish

TURKIC 101C.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisite: course 101B. Grammar, reading, conversation, and elementary composition drills. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 101C.title: Elementary Turkish

TURKIC 102A.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisites: courses 101A, 101B, 101C. Continuing study of grammar, conversation, and composition. Readings in modern literature and social science texts. May be repeated for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 102A.title: Advanced Turkish

TURKIC 102B.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisites: courses 101A, 101B, 101C. Continuing study of grammar, conversation, and composition. Readings in modern literature and social science texts. May be repeated for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 102B.title: Advanced Turkish

TURKIC 102C.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisites: courses 101A, 101B, 101C. Continuing study of grammar, conversation, and composition. Readings in modern literature and social science texts. May be repeated for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 102C.title: Advanced Turkish

TURKIC 111A.description: Lecture, three hours; laboratory, two hours. Elementary grammar, reading, and composition exercises; elementary conversation.
TURKIC 111A.title: Elementary Uzbek

TURKIC 111B.description: Lecture, three hours; laboratory, two hours. Elementary grammar, reading, and composition exercises; elementary conversation.
TURKIC 111B.title: Elementary Uzbek

TURKIC 111C.description: Lecture, three hours; laboratory, two hours. Elementary grammar, reading, and composition exercises; elementary conversation.
TURKIC 111C.title: Elementary Uzbek

TURKIC 112A.description: Lecture, three hours; laboratory, two hours. Descriptive Uzbek grammar, reading, and analysis of Uzbek literary and folkloric texts. High-style composition and conversation.
TURKIC 112A.title: Advanced Uzbek

TURKIC 112B.description: Lecture, three hours; laboratory, two hours. Descriptive Uzbek grammar, reading, and analysis of Uzbek literary and folkloric texts. High-style composition and conversation.
TURKIC 112B.title: Advanced Uzbek

TURKIC 112C.description: Lecture, three hours; laboratory, two hours. Descriptive Uzbek grammar, reading, and analysis of Uzbek literary and folkloric texts. High-style composition and conversation.
TURKIC 112C.title: Advanced Uzbek

TURKIC 116A.description: Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour; laboratory, one hour. Preparation: placement test. Proficiency-based course in descriptive Azeri grammar. Reading and analysis of Azeri literary and folkloric texts in new writing system. High-style composition and conversation. May be repeated for credit. Letter grading.
TURKIC 116A.title: Advanced Azeri

TURKIC 116B.description: Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour; laboratory, one hour. Preparation: placement test. Proficiency-based course in descriptive Azeri grammar. Reading and analysis of Azeri literary and folkloric texts in new writing system. High-style composition and conversation. May be repeated for credit. Letter grading.
TURKIC 116B.title: Advanced Azeri

TURKIC 116C.description: Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour; laboratory, one hour. Preparation: placement test. Proficiency-based course in descriptive Azeri grammar. Reading and analysis of Azeri literary and folkloric texts in new writing system. High-style composition and conversation. May be repeated for credit. Letter grading.
TURKIC 116C.title: Advanced Azeri

TURKIC 160.description: Lecture/discussion. Preparation: entrance examination. Survey of cultural history of the Turks, as seen primarily through their literature, from their early history to the present.
TURKIC 160.title: Turkish Tradition

TURKIC 165.description: Lecture, two hours; discussion, one hour. Systematic survey of Islamic documents produced in Turkish and Persian in Central Asia, with reading of primary sources in English translation. Study of special characteristics of Central Asian Islam.
TURKIC 165.title: Islamic Literary Heritage of Central Asia

TURKIC 170.description: Lecture, three hours. Required of students in Turkic program. Survey of history of Turkic and Mongolian dominions from the 3rd century B.C. to A.D. 19th century (Hsiung-nu, Hsien-pi, Juan-Juan, T'u-Chueh, Uyghur, Khitan, Karakhanid, Seljuq, Kara-Khitay, Khorazmian, Jengiz-Khanite).
TURKIC 170.title: Turco-Mongolian Nomadic Empires

TURKIC 180.description: Lecture, three hours. Required of students in Turkic program and recommended for students in Soviet studies. Ethnic and linguistic survey of the Turkic peoples.
TURKIC 180.title: Modern Turkic Languages and Peoples

TURKIC 189.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 189.title: Advanced Honors Seminars

TURKIC 189HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
TURKIC 189HC.title: Honors Contracts

TURKIC 19.description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.
TURKIC 19.title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars

TURKIC 197.description: Tutorial, one hour. Limited to juniors/seniors. Individual intensive study, with scheduled meetings to be arranged between faculty member and student. Assigned reading and tangible evidence of mastery of subject matter required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 197.title: Individual Studies in Turkic

TURKIC 199.description: Tutorial, one hour. Limited to juniors/seniors. Supervised individual research or investigation under guidance of faculty mentor. Culminating paper or project required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 199.title: Directed Research or Senior Project in Turkic

TURKIC 210A.description: Lecture, three hours. Examination of printed texts in Ottoman from 19th and 20th centuries to improve student competence to read, transliterate, and translate Ottoman texts. Readings include selections from newspapers, almanacs, travel books, and literary and historical texts. S/U or letter grading.
TURKIC 210A.title: Readings in Ottoman I

TURKIC 211.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisites: courses 210A, 210B, 210C. Organization and contents of Ottoman archives; reading and discussion of documents and registers. Introduction to use of Ottoman archive materials as a source for historical research.
TURKIC 211.title: Ottoman Diplomatics

TURKIC 596.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. May be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
TURKIC 596.title: Directed Individual Study

TURKIC 597.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. S/U grading.
TURKIC 597.title: Examination Preparation

TURKIC 599.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. S/U grading.
TURKIC 599.title: Ph.D

TURKIC 89.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC 89.title: Honors Seminars

TURKIC 89HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
TURKIC 89HC.title: Honors Contracts

TURKIC 99.description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.
TURKIC 99.title: Student Research Program

TURKIC M115A.description: (Same as Iranian M115A.) Lecture, five hours. Knowledge of Russian, Turkish, and Iranian helpful. Grammatical competence at elementary level; knowledge of basic facts of Azeri grammar; reading competence with help of dictionary; ability to write simple compositions; basic conversational skill. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC M115A.title: Elementary Azeri

TURKIC M115B.description: (Same as Iranian M115B.) Lecture, five hours. Knowledge of Russian, Turkish, and Iranian helpful. Grammatical competence at elementary level; knowledge of basic facts of Azeri grammar; reading competence with help of dictionary; ability to write simple compositions; basic conversational skill. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC M115B.title: Elementary Azeri

TURKIC M115C.description: (Same as Iranian M115C.) Lecture, five hours. Knowledge of Russian, Turkish, and Iranian helpful. Grammatical competence at elementary level; knowledge of basic facts of Azeri grammar; reading competence with help of dictionary; ability to write simple compositions; basic conversational skill. P/NP or letter grading.
TURKIC M115C.title: Elementary Azeri
